page.title: 08Places of Worship
page.content:
In the area,there are two churches.The 1st is the{St Mary the Virgin},and the 2nd is the{Methodist}church in Arkesden.The first church on the site of St Mary's was probably built in the 8th century.When the Domesday book was written,the church was built in stone.In the 13th and 14th centuries different extensions were added. For 200 years,nothing was done to the church apart from maintenance. Heavy buttresses were built around 1780 to hold up the east wall.Major restorations were undertaken in the 19th century when the church was finished as it stands now.In 1904 the 4 bells were recast and another 2 bells were added to make 6.
By Daryl Owen & Simon Rush.
